topic.title: Cannabis addiction.
topic.body:
What do you think are the first signs of a cannabis addiction ?
I'm in my mid-20s and I smoke cannabis 3 or 4 times a week.
Some weeks only 3 days: Friday evening, Saturday and Sunday.
However, I also have weak weeks where I smoke 5 to 6 days straight.
On a normal weekend I spend about 50 euros for weed (5g for 3 Days).
I do not consume alone most of the time.
At the weekend we always do something in a group. Some of my friends really consume much more than me. But that does not make it any better for me, i know.

What worries me is that if I take a break from my weed consumption, I really enjoy drinking alcohol.
So if I stop smoking from Sunday to Monday. I often drink something on Monday evening.
As if my brain had to be intoxicated to switch off.
After 3 days of consumption, I often can not sleep properly.

I've been smoking regularly for about 1 1/2 years now,
I am able to do my work. I am able to meet deadlines. I do not look like a stoner. 
Besides, I'm always on time.

However, it seems to me that I am not yet addicted. Or at least only latently.
Because I can be sober for several weeks. At least if I have to (working stuff, etc).

btw: I smoke about 50/50 with tobacco. But im not smoking tobacco normally.
Could it be that I develop a stealthy tobacco addiction ?



What would you advise me ?
Am I just imagining it or do I have a questionable consumption ?
Seriously, is 5 grams a week too much (not the heavy Haze/Kush stuff, normal weed) ?
Does anyone have any experiences ?
What could happen to me in the worst case ?
Does anyone have tips for safer use ?

1524589266_1KDRKDBSjdQmoGoQo3fdCHia7mp2G.body:
> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_229_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): Wikipedia says "Cannabis withdrawal symptoms can occur in one half of patients in treatment for cannabis use disorders. These symptoms include dysphoria (anxiety, irritability, depression, restlessness), disturbed sleep, gastrointestinal symptoms, and decreased appetite. Most symptoms begin during the first week of abstinence and resolve after a few weeks.[6]"

Well, I already know that :)
However, I wanted to go a little deeper into the topic.

Do you think a cannabis addiction is a serious danger, or about as dangerous as a caffeine addiction ?

> [styromaniac](#comment_287_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): The first signs of cannabis addiction are PTSD, epilepsy, osteoarthritis, wasting disease, cancer and acute anxiety disorder, to name a few. No, it's not addicting. It just helps people live.

Interesting you say that cannabis is not addictive?
Please excuse me for being so direct. I'm serious about my questions.

Do you think I should not worry about a possible addiction?

> [homulilly](#comment_27_1JXekkVYJNdozXPFXZEA1AJXKjkWyFciTD): Cannabis is not chemicaly addictive like drugs such as nicotine, alcohol and amphetamines, opiates or foods such as sugar, casein (found in dairy) and so on. However as disorders such as gambling, video game, or sex addiction prove, it is possible for people to become mentally addicted to activities even if they are not consuming an addictive substance. It is possible to be addicted to any activity/situation, including smoking marijuana in this sense. In your case I would try to kick the tobacco habit first as that seems the most likely substance you're consuming to cause an addiction

Thank you for your help. I will try to get away from tobacco. Do you know a good alternative for mixing w/ weed ?

> [styromaniac](#comment_289_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): Eat psilocybe mushrooms without drinking fruit juice and give it time to take effect before smoking cannabis. You'll feel so happy.

Im not really into optics and stuff.

> [styromaniac](#comment_290_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): You won't hallucinate without drinking juice.

It seems like you have a lot of experience!
Can you advice me about my weed consume ?
Do you think 5g / week is to much ?

3. The state is the market
